revised_title: The Chemistry of Nerve-Degeneration and its Relation to Choline
tldr: The authors investigate the presence of choline in the blood and cerebrospinal fluid of patients with nerve degeneration, specifically in General Paralysis of the Insane. They find that choline, derived from the breakdown of lecithin, is present in higher quantities in the fluid and blood of patients with degenerative diseases of the nervous system. The authors also explore the relationship between choline and the Marchi reaction, a method used to detect nerve fiber degeneration.
